physical_appearance: This is an image of two sony monitors, where the one on the left shows a video clip. This image of the clip shows an image of a television with a woman in it.
sgcool_label_text: Johnny Manahanâ€™s Choose (1982) is probably the earliest surviving video artwork from the Philippines and the last artwork made Manahan made before completely devoting himself to his work in television. The video is historically and culturally significant for Philippine art and is probably among the earliest video works in Southeast Asia. The video is a self-reflexive commentary on the medium of video and television.
context_1: A Fact Has No Appearance: Art Beyond the Object
subject_terms_2: Video art  Art, Philippine  Criticism  Videocasettes
